channel.title: [Req]CShell
channel.description: I read through the Ubuntu 'man' in terminal, and it had loads of references to the CShell. It went on about CSh, CC, CCompiler, etc. The odd thing is that for some reason it wasn't found on my Ubuntu. I'm thinking this might be an error during installation? Anyways, if someone could please provide me with one, I would be intensely grateful. Thanks.

item.title: [Req]CShell
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

Yeah, it is a C shell. I read about the Bourne-Again Shell too, and it said it implements features from KornShell and CShell. The problem is that I’m trying to install wxWidget so that I could get an SVN App going, and I couldn’t get it to work. When I talked to my mom’s friend about it, he said I’ll need to use CShell to do this. We looked around for it for about an hour and couldn’t find it. = \

Read full topic

item.title: [Req]CShell
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

Dont trust me on this, but I think it is a type of Shell that uses C style scripting, BASh can probably do this too

Read full topic

item.title: [Req]CShell
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

I read through the Ubuntu ‘man’ in terminal, and it had loads of references to the CShell. It went on about CSh, CC, CCompiler, etc. The odd thing is that for some reason it wasn’t found on my Ubuntu. I’m thinking this might be an error during installation? Anyways, if someone could please provide me with one, I would be intensely grateful. Thanks.

Read full topic
